verbs.description: discontinue (third-person singular simple present discontinues, present participle discontinuing, simple past and past participle discontinued)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To interrupt the continuance of; to put an end to, especially as regards commercial productions; to stop producing, making, or supplying.
examples: They plan to discontinue that design.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To consciously cease the ingestion or administration of (a pharmaceutical drug).
